bug.author: derlin
bug.summary: Showing input conditionally resets inputs defined afterwards
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I try to display some checkboxes only if the value of a selectbox is selected. This works, however any time the checkboxes are shown/hidden, all the input states beneath reset. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Use this code:
import streamlit as st
x = st.sidebar.selectbox('x', options=['one', 'two']) if x == 'two': st.sidebar.checkbox("lala")
y = st.sidebar.selectbox('y', options=['one', 'two'])
select "two" for y select "two" for x
That's it, y is back to "one". <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The state of other inputs should not change when we hide an input, or an option should be added to inputs in order to toggle their visibility / disable them. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The states are reset. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
First time user here. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version:, 0.55.0 Python version: 3.7.4 Using a virtualenv (python3 -m venv) OS version: MacOS 10.14.6 Browser version: Chrome 79.0.3945.130
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
May be related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/1041>#1041</denchmark-link> ?
